author: Gregor Stuart Hunter
title: Global Tech Slump Carries Over to Asian Stocks - WSJ
text:
U.S. stocks rose Tuesday, a day ahead of the Federal Reserveâ€™s policy decision, though social media stocks continued to struggle.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed 116.36 points, or 0.5%, to 24727.27. The S&P 500 rose 0.1%, or 4.02 points, to 2716.94, and the technology-heavy Nasdaq Composite rose 0.3%, or 20.06 points, to 7364.30 after the indexes on Monday logged their biggest daily losses since Feb. 8 as tech stocks led a broad downturn.
